result.execSummary:
The defendant Chandler L Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education and obtain diploma, HSED or GED.  Obtain employment to extent of abilities.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.
Participate and comply with psychiatric medical treatment, including attending appointments with therapist and taking prescribed medications.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Complete domestic violence class.  Comply with all Family Court orders.  May not live with current girlfriend with approval of agent and defendant's mother.  Establish paternity on child due in August.  There must be a specific visitation scheduled established.  Do not drive without valid driver's license.  Take steps necessary to obtain driver's license.  Complete anger management and other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Enroll in the Fatherhood Initiative Program and join a father's group at church.

timeConds.notes: To be served during term of probation.

superMiscConds.notes: Must participate in cognitive intervention and vocational training as deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must obey all rules of probation as previously set. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: sentence currently being served
